anime.series_title: Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo
anime.my_comments: (2023-10-08 to ?) was watching and enjoying the episodes as they were airing, but at some point I got a bit bored with the show. currently feels like the same joke stretched a bit thin. perhaps I will binge the rest at some point.

anime.series_title: Guild no Uketsukejou desu ga, Zangyou wa Iya nanode Boss wo Solo Toubatsu Shiyou to Omoimasu
anime.my_comments:
Takahashi Rie getting to go all out in a lead role is always a recipe for success
the story lacks a bit of quality and the characters can be a bit annoying, but overall it has a charm hung together by the main character and their charisma, not unlike the anime Isekai Shikkaku/No Longer Allowed in Another World.
she has a difficult personality and the overt hatred/dislike toward the male lead character is a bit off-putting - i get her character and how she has specific goals for small enjoyment in life, but the above still holds - to quote jade "im actualy fond of that stubborn, hapless side of her"

anime.series_title: Arafou Otoko no Isekai Tsuuhan Seikatsu
anime.my_comments:
It is refreshing how different the protagonists personality and priorities are from what i am used to
As a result, it leads to a fairly refreshing show to watch. Due to his personality being laid back, it makes for a nice relaxing comfort show for me
The only downside to this is how extremely relaxed and not caring he can be. When he moved towns, ditching everyone without warning, i felt the heartbreak from primula too much, which nakes me dislike the protagonist a bit.
He also doesnt seem to care about relationship commitments and will sleep with anyone who wants to with him in a friendship. This type of harem is a lot less commital, the complete opposite of a show like mushoku tensei where each partner has individual emotional and romantic basis

its almost like a slice of life anime masquerading as an adventure.
The true appeal of the show is soley in the interactions between the two main characters, and their interactions together. which is the lifeblood of a good slice of life. However, the activities they get up to in their daily life seem to be much less standard than a normal daily life, and this is the slightly less interesting "plot" is involved.

anime.series_title: Youjo Senki: Sabaku no Pasta Daisakusen
Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken: Tensura Nikki
Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken: Sukuwareru Ramiris

anime.my_comments: (2023-01-19 to 2023-01-21) doesn't take the pedal off the gas until after episode 26. the show has a perfect vibe from the art-style and sound choices which elevates the source material. Every major event which takes place feels satisfying and unexpected, and in retrospect always makes sense. (introduced as a beginner anime to a friend, and it became their favorite show) [prefer the dub, but Light voice actor better in sub] [best_character = L] [9th completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i]

(watched in one day, 2023-02-01) actually good horror. the way they built suspense/tension and kept me invested for the entire season is almost worth a 10/10. The way this was paced, out of the shows I've seen, can only be compared to deathnote. The animation is very beautiful, and the OP competes as one of my top 5 favorite. (watched originally with my housemate, then a re-watch with another friend.) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Norman] [10th completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i]

anime.series_title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Stardust Crusaders

anime.series_title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!
anime.my_comments:
(2022-12-14 to 2022-12-17) the first anime I watched when properly starting to watch anime in Dec 2022. (a random PokÃ©mon film was my true first). A weird one to start with tbh, but my friend told me this was the one lol. its funny most of the time, and I like all the characters. Kazuma is a bit hard to sympathize with sometimes though. I watched the first episode with my friend, then the rest alone [prefer the sub] [best_character = Aqua] [3rd anime completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i] (initially rated 8.7)
(2024-01-21 note, re-watching for 5th time.) the show is better than I remember, so I might change the score from an 8.8 to a 9.

(2023-01-01 to 2023-01-04) the show is unhinged and I love that. (on my second viewing, watched with friend) [prefer the sub, but dub for Power was equally good] [best_character = Denji] [8th completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i] [initially rated 10/10 - in terms of emotional investment, it is on the same level as my other 10/10s. however, I can see how it has a couple flaws, so it shouldn't be a 10/10]

(2022-12-20 to 2022-12-22) the lore gets a bit wonky until next season, and the humor takes a couple episodes to properly land, but top tier animation. [prefer the sub] [best_character = Tatsumaki] [5th completed]

(2022-12-22 to 2022-12-24) the story is slightly more entertaining than season 1s, but the animation quality takes a nosedive. A lot of what made the first season so great was the crisp animation, so this makes the premise of the show harder to enjoy. [sub] [best_character = Garou] [6th completed]

anime.series_title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Stardust Crusaders - Egypt-hen
anime.my_comments: (2023-02-09 to 2023-02-14) the same issues as with season 2. the end fight gives the score +0.1 over season 2. tbh they should have made anime-only edits to speed up the pacing and make this and the previous season a 20-25 episode season, as many of the fights feel similar even between the two seasons. The end battle of this season makes it worthwhile. (watched with a friend) [prefer sub] [best_character = Dio] [12th completed]

(2023-02-16) Raw emotion represented perfectly, with mythos and magic written in a way that relates with the human experience perfectly. entranced by the vibe of the film and the love story it tells and feel close to tears just from hearing the soundtrack. makes me feel nostalgic for something I've never experienced and unlocks my emotions in ways no other media is able to. the concept of love surviving while all other memories are lost feels right. (watched with a friend) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Mitsuha] [13th completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i]
just found a comment on YouTube which more succinctly says all which I tried to: "The entire point of Your Name is to 'capture that feeling of meeting someone for the first time but feeling like you've known eachother your whole life'" - MrTheholycole, 02/2024
Times cried watching this film: 12 - 11 rewatches and 1 first time watch as of 2025-02-28
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
29/12/2024 at 2am :
a scenario which could never happen except through magic. the perfect scenario to get two people closer together. To me, It feels like the perfect romance, in an unrealistic world.
the following are personal notes which I have no delusions of being interesting to people other than myself. though this is mostly true for my other notes.
I was in the my last year of university, 2023-02-16 at around 8pm - 11 pm. (16,350 hours ago from when I'm writing this 29/12/2024 at 2:10 am) I watched it with my housemate, who at the time was introducing me to anime, and we had been on a journey together for the past few months, starting in December 2022 taking turns choosing an anime to watch. He was already an anime veteran, whereas I had seen two anime movies before (a pokemon film and spirited away, studio ghibli.) the lights were off, and we were watching it in the sitting room. I was later thankful for this detail, as It hid my tears well. not my audible sobs however, which i think he could hear. it would only be a few months before we would finish university, and 3 months into our anime journey. It was therefore roughly halfway through our journey, though i hadn't been thinking in those terms, to me it was still so new and exciting. I would need to take the rest of this journey by myself, as my friend seemed unable to continue our sessions over discord once university finished. This film represents the peak of this experience for me, where this experience was perhaps the best time of my entire life. As a soon to be 21 year old without any dating experience, who had just been taught the meaning of love through this film, i downloaded tinder for the first time, hopeful i would too experience the same heights of intimacy portrayed in this film. though i uninstalled it a week later, realizing the hellscape of internet dating, not liking the superficial judgments (and because no-one matched me)

(2023-02-28 to 2023-04-02) An interesting universe and cool introduction to it. the action is quite creatively done. I remember the first few episodes of Levi made me hate him, which is in contrast to now him being one of my favorite characters of any series (watched with a friend) [prefer the sub but the dub is good] [best_character = Levi] [19th completed]

(2023-02-23 to 2023-02-24) very "she just like me fr". will be especially enjoyed by musicians, though is a pretty good story on its own. (watched with a friend) [sub] [best_character = ryo] [16th completed]

(2023-03-02 to 2023-03-07) has more of a story than the second and third season combined despite only being a single season which makes for better pacing (I watched the second and third seasons first because my friend said we should. "you can start on any season anyway". in retrospect I would have preferred starting here.) this season works better on many levels because the dynamics of the characters and their relationships change throughout the season, it feels less repetetive/episodic in nature. Dio is built to be a genuinely great villain and detestable character (watched with a friend) [first watched in sub, but later watched with a friend (2023-10-11) and decided dub is better, but only for part 1 as the cheesy English accents add to the comedy] [best_character = Dio] [17th completed]

(2023-10-17 to 2023-10-21) very interesting world and power system. the humor was decent and didn't take too much away from the story like it does with full metal alchemist for instance. the end sequences were very cool and add characterization. [sub] [best_character=Gojo] [#63 completed] [initially rated 8.8]

anime.series_title: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensaitachi no Renai Zunousen
anime.my_comments: (2023-06-07 to 2023-06-12) very funny premise. I felt the show shined brightest in the later part of the season when it wasn't as episodic. (watched with a friend) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Miyuki] [#36 anime completed]

(2023-05-14 to 2023-05-16) the character dynamics are usually good, resolutions to trauma also good. in this way it feels pretty similar to "rascal does not dream of bunny girl senpai". the drama elements here don't feel as earned as with bunny girl senpai though, as the relationship dynamics sometimes feel a bit extreme for the sake of it, and the pacing gets a bit weird/slow in the middle of the season. Its also a bit frustrating that they made ovas to essentially conclude the story. instead, they should have cut or sped up some of the scenes in the middle of the season to make room for the parts of the story in the ova's to be in the main season, as it very much feels like the true conclusion to the story. [sub] [best_character = Inaba] [29th completed]

(2023-04-21 to 2023-04-23) full of profound messages. it becomes surprisingly philosophical. [prefer the sub, but Reigen is good in dub] [best_character = Reigen] [best_character = Reigen] [25th completed]

[02/04/2024] having rewatched this and a few other anime multiple times, I can say this is definately my favorite of any anime I have watched so far (as of 2nd april 2024)

Some of the key moments felt a bit underwhelming, and a few running gags were questionable, but the over all quality of the show is good. anime.series_title: Seishun Buta Yarou wa Bunny Girl Senpai no Yume wo Minai
anime.my_comments: (watched in one day: 2023-02-22) very well structured story, good emotional beats. everything feels like it works. (first viewing solo, re-watched with a friend) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Mai] [14th completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i] [initially rated 9.5/10]

(2023-11-10 to 2023-11-20) A very engaging and interesting story, with a cool gimmick which doesn't overstay its welcome and isn't used in an annoying way. The weakest part of the show is the main character, and how annoying it is to watch him lash out in conversation for no reason other than his arrogance, but he improves by the end of the season and makes me feel like his obvious ship with emelia is deserved. That being said, I feel rem is the better choice, lol [sub] [best_character=Feliks] [#65 completed] (initially rated 9.1)
when I first started watching this show, I thought deaths would not hold much weight, because Subaru can just bring them back by dying himself, and as a result the stakes wouldn't feel real. That's not quite true. Its true that the stakes of death feel lower. but that doesn't make the deaths feel any less real. every time a character dies, we see their pain, suffering and fear. and we see the guilt and suffering of the characters around them, as they are effected. the last words they speak before death, which we wouldn't hear if they weren't about to die, reveal many things about their character, how this impacts upon subaru and gives him so much pressure. In the end, it perhaps one of the greatest power ideas for a story i have seen, and the way they explore that and its effect on subaru is handled expertly.
-----
rewatch: 20-02-2025 I don't remember the writing being this great. it is more of a masterpiece than i thought
you would think the stakes are low if he can die and reset everything. but it introduces an entirely more existential feeling set of stakes. when people die, instead of sadness, we feel worry and suspense of if the next reset point will be before or after their death, and if things will be possible to undo, which adds an entire extra dimension to it
Rezero brings into the equation something i had never thought of before: knowing that you have some level of control over something, but being unsure if your input will be successful due to factors you cannot control, is vastly more terrifying than simply the idea of people dying. Once someone is dead, you can feel grief and move on. But if someone dies and you might be able to bring them back at the cost of your own life, the feeling is so much worse. You dont know if they are dead forever, the fear of death in the face of what you need to do to bring them back, or the feeling of guilt that you dont really want to die even if its to save them.
This isnt very well described, but whatever, im not submitting this for an exam or anything, its merely for myself. if i can understand my own thoughts, that is all that matters
____
2025_03_10 novel reading
A great part of this show and the m3chanism return by death, is we can more thoughroughly explore how characters react in certain situations, and cone to undersrand them more
2025_03_21 after reading novel 4, i'm annoyed at how much was cut from this part of the adaption on the royal selection

(2023-04-16) (watched in the cinema with the university anime society) The animation was very beautiful, and the soundtrack was exceptional. the character relationships felt slightly underdeveloped, but the film is meant to be more of a cinematic experience and a spectacle than a deep story. [sub] [best_character = Suzume] [22nd completed]

(2023-06-16 to 2023-06-25) the concept is very cool and the first 12 episodes were decent but the quality dropped after. (watched first 14 episodes with a friend, then finished the rest alone) [sub] [best_character = Asuna] [#40 anime completed]

(2024-10-08 to 2024-10-10) #117 watched
my kind of show. liked it a lot.
I relate a decent amount to the main character, I also like to imagine pretend realities. If i actually had his powers i might act in a similar way, with the same goals (to look cool af)
hes such a dork and i love that. I always end up grinning whenever hes doing stuff.

(2023-04-11) the first 3 episodes are mostly fine, but the story gets increasingly worse after that. I would recommend reading the manga instead of watching this because they cut large parts of the manga to fit what would have been 2-3 more seasons into 1 resulting in too many time skips to get used to the flow and a number of unsatisfying plot points and conclusions. [sub] [best_character = emma] [21st completed]

(2024-11-25 to 2025-01-17)
great world building (though the video-game like level systems are not my thing)
the controversy and propaganda in this world were very frustrating to watch (by design) but cathartic to see progress. This aspect of the story was masterfully constructed.
the main cast of characters is filled with cute characters, which was an additional appeal for me.
voice acting was top tier all through the show, was fully sucking you into any scene with high stakes and low stakes with convincing performance.
the animation was mostly good, with some great scenes. a bit of dodgy CGI here and there, and some power point presentation moments, but these don't detract too much from the over all tone.
I especially found the opening to the story to be very compelling, launching our naÃ¯ve protagonist into a world he thinks loves him, but turns against him.
The spear guy and bitch (her actual name now btw) were excessively annoying, to the point i couldn't understand why she wasn't at least exiled, and him given the same treatment the shield hero was at the start.
-----
while the tone of the show was great across the board, the story itself was a bit slow in places. while perfect at the start, it rapidly slowed to a more casual pace, and then became slightly confused by the end of the show. This doesn't make shield hero any less worth watching, but was a slight detriment to my enjoyment.
(2023-11-26 to 2024-01-09) was a fun ride, filled with edginess and gore. a bit too much at times. The ideas the story presents are interesting. [#71 completed]

(saw the first 10 minutes in like 2014, finally watched in 2018 ish) saw it years ago, honestly felt like a fever dream with how bizarre the story was. don't remember fully enjoying the subplots or the guy who it turned out was a dragon all along, but that could just be because of the mindset I had while watching it [2nd anime completed]
--- 20/04/2024 after a rewatch I rated it 9/10 its better than i remember it being. manages to make things feel unnerving in unexpected ways, always feels there is a deeper mystery going on.
(2023-05-22) the premise is brilliant, but I felt they pushed the improbability of coincidences slightly too hard. [sub] [best_character = Yor] [#31 anime completed]

anime.series_title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!
anime.my_comments:
(2023-04-06 to 2023-06-22) the perfect spinoff
doesn't feel like an off brand and worse written spinoff, but nonetheless has less charm than the main series due to missing the main cast dynamics. it picks up and is usual konosuba quality after episode 9. [sub] [watched while airing from episode 1] [best_character = Megumin] [#39 anime completed]

(2023-10-03 to 2023-10-05) was a fairly cute show. was able to switch off and eat while watching. I appreciate the appeal of having someone who unconditionally dotes on you, but I also recognize this is a bit unrealistic and perhaps a bad message for the anime to send, as the message isnt to challenge the existing social system which lead to the character being overworked, but that the solution was for someone to do all the housework and pamper him. if you wanted a fox god romance story "Spice and Wolf" is a good choice [sub] [best_character = Senko] [#56 anime completed]

(2024-05-09 to 2024-06-07) a lot faster paced than I'm used to. yet somehow feels slower paced than most other anime. the story feels similar to Rascal Does Not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai, but with a more complicated and thought out world building. this doesn't make it necessarily better because I didn't particularly feel the depth of the monsters or "aberrations" and their backstory added much, at least yet.
i had slightly higher expectations for some reason, but i do plan to continue the rest of the show over time.
#89

The vanilla romcom experience no fanservice, no gimmicks and no thrills.
love and laughter, in normal sized portions.
it wasn't too sad, and it wasn't too happy. Perhaps a bit too safe at times.
I would normally prefer some more quirks in an anime, like seen in love is war. but this anime gets points as well for having the couple get together near the beginning of the show. that was satisfying to see.

(2023-05-05 to 2023-05-16) the pacing feels a bit slow and the narration feels a bit on the nose, but there is a charm to it nonetheless. the characters motivations feel very real and its easy to get invested and put yourself in his shoes. anime.series_title: Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans
anime.my_comments: (2023-03-27 to 2023-04-17) It has decent fight scenes and the character dynamics are somewhat compelling, but the pacing was generally slow (watched with friend) [sub] [best_character = itsuka orga] [24th completed]

(2024-05-03 - 2024-05-06) #87 completed [best character=Nazuna]
established the idea of the story with a very effective hook and first 2 episodes.
then the plot as a bit slow. or maybe slice of life isn't my thing. they weren't wasting time with the slice of life episodes though, as we were slowly introduced to more characters who expanded the story.
finally, we get to the point where two separate rugs are pulled. both were a surprise and dramatically increased the depth of the show.
from the start to the end, the show was a fairly 2 dimensional but hyper and enjoyable ride, and evolved into an introspection into the meaning of love and life itself.
I'm looking forward to seeing Yamori turned into a vampire maybe in the next season, hopefully it isn't dragged too long because I don't see this premise working as a slice of life for much longer.

An emotive exploration of trauma and how it can lead to a damaged person, with a single minded goal for revenge.
It may be justified by helping others, and still be useful efforts. But the motives and actions are warped by trauma
The first episode is extremely effective at giving us the full justification for hating goblins.
I also like how they handled his helmet. Its like a shield which protects him from the world. it helps him mentally not need to connect with other people through facial features. This is why it is significant when he takes his helmet off and realises the people around him are now peers in the final episode ... although, seems like he was so handsome the animators weren't brave enough to draw his face at all

(2023-05-25 to 2023-05-28) a very beautiful show. made me cry a few times. Could have done with more episodes cause a few of the side characters felt one dimensional and the plot progression feels like it ends a bit abruptly, but I think overall it tells a nice story. (watched with a friend) [sub] [best_character = Tachibana Kanade] [#33 anime completed]
(2023-04-06 to 2023-04-16 at 2 am) (watched with a friend) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Levi] [23rd completed]

anime.my_comments: (2023-04-09) 9/10 a short but sweet (2 minutes) animated journey where we follow saitama attempting to get to the shop in time for the sale. essentially one of the running gags in the series, represented well. there is no dialogue (just music), so the emotions of characters and interactions are surprisingly well handled non verbally.

anime.series_title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!: Kono Subarashii Choker ni Shukufuku wo!

anime.series_title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo! 2: Kono Subarashii Geijutsu ni Shukufuku wo!

anime.my_comments: (2023-04-14) 10/10 a music video which greatly transforms the song it was made for

(2023-04-24 to 2023-04-24) has similar messages to season 1, but delivers them better in my opinion. the story feels more interesting this time, so every episode had me hooked. [prefer the sub, but Reigen is good in dub] [best_character = Reigen] [26th completed]

(2023-04-24 to 2023-05-03) a satisfying conclusion to mobs story, emotional development for Reigen feels earned and the redemption of our first proper villain in season 1 (ekubo), cartoonishly evil as he was back then, somehow works. [prefer the sub but reigen is better in dub] [best_character = Reigen] [27th completed]

(2023-05-09) felt very random at times with how chaotic it became. aspects of the story felt a bit disjointed. The love story was a bit shallow, but that's fine and if anything was one of the better aspects. What the film does a good job at is generating the vibe for this semi fictional sport. the animation gave the film a grimy feel lending itself to the cyberpunk themes very well. (watched in a lecture room with the university anime society) [sub] [best_character = JP] [28th completed]
in simpler terms: the story was all over the place and uninteresting. the art-style was actually pretty cool, but difficult to look at for a whole movie length. I don't particularly appreciate cars, but racing can be cool. unfortunately, this aspect didn't appeal to me too much either as this was distracted by multiple side plots of gangs and monsters and scifi stuff happening, which i found somewhat jarring and distracting from the interesting elements.

(2023-05-16) 8/10 Is the actual ending for the season, and would improve the first seasons score with its inclusion. Ideally they should have paced season 1 faster (as it felt a bit slow for most of the middle episodes) and included these in the main season, which would make the anime an easy 8/10.

anime.series_title: Gakuen Mokushiroku: HIGHSCHOOL OF THE DEAD
anime.my_comments:
(2024-04-27 to 2024-12-22) #127 watched
- the entire plot is predictable from start to finish, - the zombie elements are built entirely from clichÃ© and other preexisting concepts without bringing anything new - the characters were all dumb and annoying to listen to
rather watch The Walking Dead (2010 - 2022 US TV series) for this genre. stop watching after season 6.
I can only say that i was not nearly horny enough when watching this to fully appreciate its charm, as that seems to the the main target here. If it has a plot as engaging as a hentai, but is only an ecchi show, they may as well have just bitten the bullet to make it a hentai. the jiggle physics are arguably revolutionary by hentai standards for the time
(rated with more precision with advanced metrics)

(2023-05-24 to 2023-06-05) A slightly weaker beginning to the season, but by the end I was more invested. Its a show where I have never felt stressed, so I know watching it will cheer me up. [sub] [best_character = Loid] [#35 anime completed]

2023-05-28 some character moments felt a bit forced (the grandfathers sacrifice at the end) but otherwise a nice film with not too much depth. Reminds me of Tintin, the 2011 film. (watched with a friend) [sub] [best_character = Lupin] [#32 anime completed]

(2023-06-13 to 2023-06-15) good story and message. Made me cry more than any other anime so far. The animation style felt a bit weird, but that's not a huge deal. the pacing felt a bit slow but it was consistent. (watched with a friend) [sub] [#37 anime completed]

anime.series_title: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai?: Tensaitachi no Renai Zunousen

This is less of a problem now. (wanted to watch with a friend, following the first season, but had to watch alone from this point) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Ishigami] [#38 anime completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i]

the character motivations were well justified. good sound design, good pacing. the world building was decent. a very good 12 episode anime to watch, for instance, while in between seasons for jojo as a break.
I didn't like was how it suddenly felt like everyone had tan power out of nowhere.
[sub] [best character = Gabimaru] [#83 anime completed]

anime.series_title: Zom 100: Zombie ni Naru Made ni Shitai 100 no Koto
anime.my_comments:
(2023-07-18 to 2023-12-31) great art-style. watching it is very fun and doesn't give you much stress, which for the zombie genre is funny. I think the message is great; that even in the worst situations you should be enjoying life to the fullest.
The first 2(maybe 3) episodes felt somewhat better than the rest of the show, as a 9/10. once they explored the concept for the first time, it becomes somewhat by the books and has a villain introduced etc. [#69 completed]

anime.series_title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Ougon no Kaze
anime.my_comments: (2023-07-27 to 2023-10-08) the first 10 episodes were amazing, but it slowly became a bit boring to watch and I failed to connect to any of the new characters on as deep a level as I have with previous parts. expected Joutarou to somehow appear near the end because they seemed to imply that with the first few episodes, and its a bit of a shame that Polnaroff was reintroduced just for that [sub] [best_character = Giorno] [#59 anime completed]

(2023-07-02) from the first episode to the last, this season felt at the top of its game and was peak love is war. The animators clearly have a passion for their craft and I love all of the references sprinkled throughout (such as bohemian rhapsody and your name song references) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Miko] [#41 anime completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i]

anime.my_comments:
(2024-10-12 to 2024-10-15) #119 watched
a somewhat boring plot with funny moments and good fanservice
---- 2025-01-22 but i later went on to watch more of the series... honestly its more of the same, but with a more interesting plot. The characters are all likable, and this is the main aspect of the story which grew on me.

anime.series_title: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: First Kiss wa Owaranai
anime.my_comments: (2023-07-19) a step back in comedy quality from season 3, and I think some of the jokes they did use dragged on (eg baby Kaguya didn't land for me) but the quality of the portrayal of romance development makes it still a great watch. It feels like the conclusion to the Kaguya x Miyuki confession arc, which seems to be the premise of the show (though i hear there is more manga to adapt, like an extra half of the show left lol) [prefer the sub] [best_character = Miyuki] [#44 anime completed]

(2024-07-03 - 2024-10-06) #114 watched
a perfect adaption from the manga.
A lot of reveals occurred this season, and we had a lot of great moments. the series manages to create a wide range of tones, serious, tense, comedic and light hearted. all extremely well.
Kana continues to make me jealous of aqua.
The only aspect i am less fond of is the crow girl. Something about this plot point feels contrived and half hearted. So far, at this point in Oshi no Ko, it is the only such element.
(2023-07-06 to 2023-07-12) 8.3/10 surprisingly good stories, but definitely missing having the main protagonists

(2024-09-01 - 2024-09-01) #103 watched
solid concept, some very good philosophical ideas. It was fun to essentially follow the villain for once.
However, a lot of war tactics and table discussions.
the god thing was a bit overdone.
"men are fundamentally still animals who act on impulse first and foremost" went hard as an ending idea. and not just how to claim a victory, but how to make use of one.
the artstyle was epic, though I was a bit annoyed they reused the same sequence for the spells each time a magic bullet was fired.
voice acting impeccable, the energy and evil faces of Tanya were well worth watching it just for that.

(2023-07-09 to 2023-07-22) This part of season 3 reached the highest octane of the show so far and even came close to beating part 1s fight with Levi and Kenny for satisfying animation, though the story in general is also more interesting this part, which justifies the higher rating. (watched with a friend) [prefer the sub, but dub is decent compared to most anime] [best_character = Levi] [#45 anime completed] [!iat the time, my favorite show.!i]

(2024-08-23 to 2024-08-27) #98 watched
Very enjoyable. I was at the edge of my seat every episode.
The characters feel very realistic.
I think Rui is the best girl. Momo is very good too. the literature club president was lacking character development, but had the most potential of any girl character and has an amazing voice actor. Hina was annoying.
has a frustrating ending, knowing that the show is likely not to get a second season. so i started the manga. so far, there are is a lot more detail, but the tone is a bit more lighthearted which I think doesn't suit the story as much.
the story structure is slightly unsatisfying, because it feels artificial, trying to engineer the most extreme situation at every turn, without much character chemistry to blend it together. but the situations are very dramatic, which is easy to get invested in.
--- update: dropped the manga because the story got frustrating. every turn is engineered to make the most annoying outcome it seems. there was very little to find satisfying in such a story.

(2023-09-05 to 2023-09-06) when meeting in secret, it is usually several seconds after Persia disappears that someone else walks into the scene, almost catching them. this makes the show reasonably easy to predict. The romance between the two characters feels a bit rushed into, as he manages to win her over from enemies to romance in the span of seconds. this picks up towards the end of the show where their romance manages to feel more organic and earned. The characters are all very dumb, which can make it frustrating to watch, as most of the issues the characters face are as a result of dumb decisions like walking around in public undisguised or not getting rid of a bra of the other teams uniform when this would obviously be incriminating. anime.series_title: Pocket Monsters: Celebi Toki wo Koeta Deai
anime.my_comments: (2007-2009 somewhere) probably the first anime I ever watched, even before spirited away. it was difficult trying to find the specific PokÃ©mon film based on the fragmented memories I have of it, and I have no clue when exactly I watched it. [1st anime completed]

(2023-10-02 to 2024-03-22) a great representation of the inevitable emotionally detached personality that would result from immortality [watched while airing from episode 1] [#80 anime completed] [best character=frieren]
Kraft gives me the impression of someone who has been alive 10-15x longer than frieren. Serie gives gives me the impression of someone who has been alive since the dawn of civilization. Serie has a very difficult to deal with personality. she developed this as a result of her overwhelming difference in power and maturity to those around her, resulting in a difficulty to connect with people emotionally Frieren would have eventually developed this way too, but her attatchments to humans has now prevented that from happening in the future. Krafts religion stems from a need for approval from others. since all others around him die, the only person he can think of is an all seeing entity who can appreciate his doings: a god. the anime as a whole covers religion in a skeptical light. The only justifications behind belief have been shallow and self interested in nature.

(2023-10-03 to 2023-10-05) the show is an acid trip. Hard to tell sometimes what is actually happening and what is an animation choice for effect. The story, while weirdly presented, is somewhat engaging. I can see how Makima from chainsaw man is inspired by Haruko. The comedic choices with animation feel similar to soul eater (though with soul eater it felt less intrusive to the plot). [sub] [best_character = Haruko] [#57 anime completed]
(2023-10-03 to 2023-10-08) most aspects feel cheesy. the sister dynamic was at least interesting to watch and genuinely sad. [sub] [best_character = Katia] [#58 anime completed]
(2023-10-02) 9/10 another amazing song from Yoasobi. I will admit it doesn't fit the anime as well as idol, so not quite 10/10

(2023-10-10 to 2023-10-13) an immersive story. The merchant dealings always felt real, and his skill was shown. the romance isn't too clichÃ© and has just the right amount of development over the course of 13 episodes. The animation feels a bit out dated, so I look forward to the new adaption which is apparently being made in 2024 [prefer the dub] [best_character = Holo] [#61 anime completed]

(2023-10-10 to 2023-10-12) Don't watch episodes 3,4 and 7 if you want a peaceful slice of life witch traveling anime. episode 11 serves as a better conclusion too, with episode 12 being perhaps the weakest episode of the season, so this can be skipped too. without these episodes, there is an underlying great show that could be rated 8.5/10 - it has been shown that male wizards are in the academy, so how come all our characters seem to be witches? [sub] [best_character = Fran] [#60 anime completed]

(2024-04-02 to 2024-04-13)
a fun show. doesn't have much depth. but i love the aesthetic and character designs a lot.
I watched initially because the main character reminded me of Miko Iino from Love is War.
[sub] [best character = Maika] [#84 anime completed]

(2023-10-13 to 2023-10-15) slower paced than season 1, but their relationship feels just as real as last season, which is the main selling point of the show. [prefer the dub] [best_character = Holo] [#62 anime completed]

anime.series_title: Ookami to Koushinryou: MERCHANT MEETS THE WISE WOLF
anime.my_comments:
(2024-04-02 to 2024-10-29) #122 watched Best character=holo
a better adaption than the previous season, which itself wasn't too bad.
in terms of animation, it is slightly inconsistent, but shines at certain moments. They played into their strengths to have breathtaking visuals over fluid animation for the majority of the anime, and it works for a slow paced show like this.
The story flows better than the original, though i cant pinpoint the exact reasons why from memory. the dialogue simply felt snappier and the show brought my interest more, despite covering a similar amount of story in a similar run length.
I was and am still a fan of the originals, but they managed to surpass it in almost every aspect. even the voice acting (by the same people!) has improved. I double checked the scenes side by side, and found the voices to be much more believable and synergetic than the previous adaption for the same voice actors, which may even explain my earlier point about the show feeling easier to get into than the previous adaption.

anime.my_comments:

If I have one main complaint about this part it is not enough Feliks :< [sub] [best_character=Echidna] [#67 completed] [initially rated 8.9]
2025-02-23 tbh i think i would have taken echidnas offer of a contract. doesn't seem to bad to me she wouldn't be forcing you to return by death, just giving you information and allowing herself to be used by you some information might be leading you to a future which satisfies her curiosity, but as per her contract, she is also forced to take into account the future you desire as the minimum criteria

(2024-04-15 to 2024-04-21)
A very beautiful show.
-The characters are all extremely compelling and well written, -the plot for the episodes was very well done. maybe more episodic than I usually like, but this didn't go badly -the art style was beautiful and the characters very pretty -I was invested the entire time, meaning I finished this 24 episode season in 1 week.
-I hoped the romance aspect would develop a bit, but we cant have everything. its not the main focus of the show. [sub] [best character = Jinshi] [#85 anime completed]

anime.series_title: Ore dake Level Up na Ken
anime.my_comments:
(2024-01-09 to 2024-03-30)
perfectly captures the feeling of grinding a game.
While most good-great anime have a balanced story which leaves me satisfied and thinking about the characters, story and worldbuilding for long after it has finished, solo leveling only gives me a sense of satisfaction and dopamine during the episode.
This makes it worth watching, especially while drunk or with a group of friends, but the result is finding myself not thinking about it after the episode ends, which may result in me forgetting this anime. [sub] [best character = Seong Jin-U] [#82 completed]

anime.series_title: Ore dake Level Up na Ken: Season 2 - Arise from the Shadow
anime.my_comments: The scene with the mother coming back is extremely effective in a number of ways. while we may have thought the main reason its so satisfying to watch the mother come back, is because of a simple family reunion. for me its also a great character moment. We've seen sung jinwoo seemingly devolve into a cold blooded warior, but now we see what it was for. The fact he can cry shows that he's still human.

(2024-04-15 to 2024-09-22) #105 watched
good animation, fun intro.
The show didn't manage to grip me with the story, and I didn't end up liking the characters all that much.
Perhaps If i played the game, this show would mean more to me.

(2024-05-31 to 2025-01-26)
it has funny moments
it has a good portrayal of depression, and how it can be caused by loneliness and neglect. How a single person may be capable of changing you for the better, bringing you out of the darkness.
There isn't anything particularly subtle or deep, but its got feel good elements which do not need to be complex
at first I was extremely bored by the premise. after giving it a second chance and completing the show, i was still bored a lot of the time, but there were redeeming elements i hadn't noticed before. the world building is also starting to shape up to be interesting. Might watch season 2 at some point.
(2024-02-15 to 2024-06-21) a borderline hentai show with a vaguely interesting plot. funnier to watch with equally weeby friends than alone #92 anime watched
(2024-07-08 to 2024-07-20) There isn't much I dislike. its good feeling show, but not a huge amount of substance. lemon was my favorite character #94 anime watched

anime.series_title: Watashi ga Motenai no wa Dou Kangaetemo Omaera ga Warui!
anime.my_comments:
#125 watched
painful to watch but that feels like the main appeal of the show. the story is constructed by cringe.

(2024-07-27 to 2024-10-23) #120 watched
Aesthetically, it is my style of show. some of the characters are likable the animation, sound and voice acting are all pretty good
"depressed guy is somehow the most charismatic man ever" is actually somewhat entertaining to follow, and is carried by a great voice actor. but The over all story is not too interesting. I suppose when you follow a depressed guy who has no interest in moving forward, this rubs off on the viewer in the end.
in this way, the shows concept is also its own undoing, because having the main character be so depressed and suicidal to the point of making it a running gag, only goes to make him incompatible with the rest of the cast even if he is interesting to watch on his own.

anime.series_title: Seitokai ni mo Ana wa Aru! PV
Kawaikereba Hentai demo Suki ni Natte Kuremasu ka?
anime.my_comments:
(2024-08-22 to 2024-08-23) #97 watched
its dumb, but i enjoy it

2024-10-05 to 2024-12-20 #126 watched
A lot of elements which somehow work together
Phychics aliens ghosts and nuts
The show is simultaneously nuts, and about nuts.
About two nutters who belive in aliens and ghists respectively, but dont believe in the others nutty theories, until they are both forced to experience the others theories are real. Then things get nutty and our nutty male protagonist looses his nuts.
Aesthetically the show isn't really my thing. But its so consistently good that I was engaged the whole time.
___
What was that cliffhanger of an ending. Bruh. Most abrupt finish to a 12 episode show ive seen. Makes it feel like a 25 episide plan, but only received funding for 12
Ill have fun finishing that scene in s2 in ages

Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken: Guren no Kizuna-hen

anime.my_comments:
(2024-09-22 to 2024-09-23) #107 watched
jarring cgi in places, but the animation was great when it needed to be,
excellent cinematograpy, pacing and tone.
it would have worked better as the introduction to the show than bakemonogatari in my opinion.

#115 watched
Overlord is a very good show.
Though I think it is a challenge to watch it and disconnect morals in order to root for the characters.
Its not an experience I have felt with other shows, making overlord somewhat unique in my experience.
------------
another interesting aspect is how the main character is forced into his position. on one hand, he has no moral compass any more due to being undead. However, he also constantly needs to bluff his way to maintian the guardians approval of him as a perfect genius strategist/leader, otherwise they might turn against him at some point. However, this is stretched a bit too thin in my opinion, as he has always used the exact same technique of just making things up as he goes and then saying "just as planned", then his guardians think of the explanation for him "all according to plan, as expected you would figure it out". I think after a while the smartest of them, demurgus, would figure out this pattern. Perhaps he is just too blinded by his admiration to ainz, but it feels slightly unbelievable.
-----
this was the season of acting and pretending. the pandoras actor pretending to be ainz for that fight was wonderful.
the grand scheme from Renner finally coming to fruition, with all the hints along the way finally paying off was masterfully executed. it was beautiful in a horrifying way how she fully became the same, outside and inside, becoming a demon. With her character, they are able to force us to acknowledge the wrongdoing of ainz without having a mental block stopping us from acknowledging it by making us grow accustomed to seeing her as darkness in a light world, then putting her darkness amongst the other darkness where there is no contrast, and forcing us to acknowledge that if we dislike her character, it is a double standard.
----
I love the show. but i also hate it at times. it can be difficult to stomache the pain and war. This is also what makes the show unique, as its not a feeling anime has given me before. I would look at anyone who rates this show a 10/10 with caution. it would increase my suspicions of them being a sadist.

anime.series_title: Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute! 2nd season
Yarinaoshi Reijou wa Ryuutei Heika wo Kouryaku-chuu
Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka II
Chi. Chikyuu no Undou ni Tsuite
anime.my_comments:
(2024-11-26 to 2025-03-16) a nice representation of astronomy
an excellent demonstration of the scientific method
and how truths about our universe are impossible to be repressed because they will always be rediscovered, and human curiosity will recur.
it is has engaging plotline spanning multiple main characters over multiple decades, each carrying the baton of truth to the next, finally ending with real world history as we know it (Copernicus)
unfortunately, the ending was slightly confusing and wastes the momentum built up. The many main character swaps across the show were well timed, and kept the pacing going well and engaging once you realize the show is about concepts rather than characters. but the ending is simply another main character switch, where we spend another whole episode learning about a new person, which is wasted screen time as this does not have payoff, unlike the other main character swaps where learning more about the character adds to the tone and depth of the show for the next 5-10 episodes.

anime.series_title: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka III
anime.my_comments:
#131 watched it has moments where you can fully enjoy the story and get invested, but these moments are carried by a lot of exposition.
this season leans heavy into telling, and not showing the story. possibly an issue of adapting from a light novel where there is so much backstory.
In the end, everything came together to a satisfyingly conclusion even if there were a good number of moments which made me roll my eyes.

the jokes are funny sometimes, as the show has a genuinely baffling premise in its absurdity, but the novelty soon wears off and I was left with the feeling that the show has no substance and that i had wasted my time. I feel no need to watch season 2.

anime.series_title: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka IV: Shin Shou Meikyuu-hen
anime.my_comments:
(2025-01-06 - 2025-01-15)
A flawed but fun show
the show will go to the climactic part of the story, but then sudenly remember it has a whole episode worth of diaalogue it needs to give us via exposition. however, this was less immersion breaking than with season 3.
other occasions require the cahracters to stand around watching as the villain laughs and monologues at them, though this is a problem with a large amount of anime. it is indicative of a lower quality script.
despite my complaints above, I have come to like the show over the last few seasons. it has a likable cast, and bell (the main) has grown on me a lot since season 1, which shows his character growth.
im not much of a fan of the worldbuilding, which i think can be attributed to the mechanics of the world (eg level systems dont make sense outside of videogames to me, though at least this show doesnt include a holographic gui only the player can see, which is extremely annoying) otherwise, i like the political systems and familia structures which can be quite interesting.
2025/01/09 As of ep 5, seems like the best season so far
yes

anime.series_title: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka IV: Shin Shou Yakusai-hen
anime.my_comments:
(2025-01-16 to 2025-01-22)
the most frustrating aspect of the show is how many quality love interests exist, and the single worst one is the only one the main character is interested in in the long run.
This cour managed to make ryo, who was already a decent enough character, another such character. Through an arduous 4 day journey in the deepest level of the dungeon, bell and ryo somehow manage to survive together, ryo teaching bell how to survive, and bell forcing ryo to survive. they both grew a lot as characters from this experience.

still has a lot of charm, and the characters feel very faithfully adapted, and the intro/outro are as compelling as with season 1.
But the overall story and jokes aren't as high quality as before. I would recommend this show to anyone who is a fan of every show featured in it, otherwise only watch season 1 if you only are a fan of a subset of shows.

anime.series_title: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka V: Houjou no Megami-hen
anime.my_comments:
best season so far
this show keeps getting better
________ (After completion) Starts very well for the first half The second half is paced a bit weakly The final episode is a home run
The season of syr/freya, they made a great piece of work on her character, making her the most complex and compelling character in the show.
A twisted but not evil individual, who ultimately wants normal love and life, but is too stuck in her role as a godess, and the idea of needing love to be fulfilled. Really, she just needed to be a normal human without god status to achieve this, because love is not genuine if it is controlled or forced. As this is how the last episode goes, this makes the story for this season the most compelling of the danmach series so far

anime.series_title: Tensei Shitara Slime Datta Ken OVA
anime.my_comments: worth watching as a fan of Tensura

(2023-05-23 to ?) Genuinely good worldbuilding and an interesting story. a few very annoying characters and a few badass ones to balance it out. going to read the manga because apparently it diverges from episode 36.
(2023-06-09 to ?) honestly want to wait to watch this properly because I didn't pay attention enough to understand wtf was going on
reading the light novel, then coming back to this
(2023-06-17 to ?) a pretty funny show. gives the vibes of scooby-doo. I don't imagine completing it ever, or at least any time soon
(2023-10-24 to ?) cute show but not what I currently want to watch
(2023-10-05 to ?) watched the first few episodes while they were airing, but the show didn't particularly grip me. might come back to it later.

anime.series_title: Watashi no Oshi wa Akuyaku Reijou.
anime.my_comments: (2023-10-08 to ?) paused because i dont enjoy it enough right now to want to continue

(2024-07-08 to ?)
ehhhhhh the first episode was fun, but after this, nothing meaningful happens.
I can see the appeal for those who find the concept extremely funny, but for me the novelty has worn off.

started 2024-07-14 was watching this with a friend, but he stopped watching with me, and i don't feel particularly inclined to continue on my own.
I haven't set the score listing as any score with less than half of the show runtime is worthless to judge the whole show by (my own rules, not everyone else, feel free to do it yourself) However, my score only based on these 4 episodes is 5/10

anime.series_title: NEET Kunoichi to Naze ka Dousei Hajimemashita
anime.my_comments: the cast dynamic doesn't work for me

2025-01-07
I dont see the point
feels extremely dull to watch
an extremely unrelatable character is put into a world which for some reason is a duplicate of a film she likes there is probably some in world explanation for this, but it doesn't feel worthwhile waiting to understand. the payoff wont make the situation itself any more enjoyable.
I was slightly enjoying the introduction to the show, setting up her character as an annoying director of anime and manga, but i knew it would be an isekai going into this, and thought it might be good for that side as well. it doesn't seem to be.
If i hear great things about this show later on, i may come back to it.

anime.series_title: Shinchou Yuusha: Kono Yuusha ga Ore TUEEE Kuse ni Shinchou Sugiru

anime.my_comments: (2023-10-05 to ?) the humor doesn't land for me. some of the story elements work and I like the animation style, but so far I feel like this was over-rated by a large margin
